intro: Osteospermum plebeium, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals, often blooming in spring and summer. Osteospermum plebeium typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its structure includes a central stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and a robust root system that helps it survive in arid conditions.
